dct_title_s: Carte du Mexique ou de la Nlle. Espagne contenant aussi le Nouveau Mexique, la Californie, avec une partie des pays adjacents
dct_description_sm: projett√©e et assujettie au ciel par Mr. Bonne.
California shown as an island with a rounded northern coast. Depicts small islands between California and the North American continent.
Title cartouche (lower left) with floral motif.
Upper left and right corners: "XXXVI" and "C32"
Lower left corner, inside neatline: "Arrivet, inv. & sculp."
Inside cartouche: "A PARIS Chez Laltre, rue St. Jaques, a la Tille de Bordeaux. avec. Privd."
A known forgery. There is evidence of a change in the plate in order to create California as an island. The map maker R. Bonne (1727-1794) lived later than the date on the map.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
